info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.app_type
info.description:
App Type object defines a application profile type from an advanced monitoring/security point of view.
An App type is a set of (micro) services that interact with one another and function as an application.
Services can be made members of a particular AppType set by adding label ves.io/app_type=app_type.metadata.name to services.
App type object is the profile for one such application label. One can define various AI/ML features that can
be enabled for a given application in this object. All services in a given namespace that are labeled with
same ves.io/app_type label are assumed to be a single application. In a different namespace as two different
instances of same application.
app_type object is recommended per tenant and present only in shared namespace.
This way AI/ML modeled developed for a given application can be shared across namespaces or deployments.
app_setting object can be used to enable a app_type monitoring profile in a given namespace.

post.description: Create App type will create the configuration in namespace metadata.namespace

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

parameters.name: metadata.namespace
parameters.description:
namespace

x-example: "staging"
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

put.description:
Update the configuration by replacing the existing spec with the provided one.
For read-then-write operations a resourceVersion mismatch will occur if the object was modified between the read and write.

parameters.description:
namespace

The namespace in which the configuration object is present

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
name

x-example: "name"
The name of the configuration object to be fetched

parameters.name: response_format
parameters.description:
The format in which the configuration object is to be fetched. This could be for example
    - in GetSpec form for the contents of object
    - in CreateRequest form to create a new similar object
    - to ReplaceRequest form to replace changeable values

Default format of returned resource
Response should be in CreateRequest format
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
Response should have other objects referring to this object
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object

content_type.description: The HTTP Content-Type header value specifying the content type of the body.

data.description: The HTTP request/response body as raw binary.

extensions.description:
Application specific response metadata. Must be set in the first response
for streaming APIs.

app_typeAPIEPCategory.description:
The category of an API endpoint.

Discovered API Endpoint.
The API Endpoint is imported from user swagger.
The API Endpoint is present at the API Inventory.
The API Endpoint is considered as part of Shadow API.
Deprecated API Endpoint.
Non-API Endpoint.
app_typeAPIEPCategory.title: APIEP Category

app_typeAPIEPDynExample.description: List of Examples of expanded URL components for API endpoints that are collapsed with a dynamic component that is identified automatically
app_typeAPIEPDynExample.title: API endpoint dynamic example

component_examples.description:
List of sample URL(s) that are collapsed

Example: ` "[d0161a1e-044e-427b-a806-3bad9eac97fc, a74eb844-6d91-474c-9874-f19fa3983f4d]"`
component_examples.title: List of expanded URLs

component_identifier.description:
Dynamic component used to collapse sample URLs given in Expanded URLs

Example: ` "/api/v1/user_id/DYN"`
component_identifier.title: Dynamic component

app_typeAPIEPInfo.description:
Information about automatically identified API endpoint
Each identified API endpoint has a CollapsedURL and Method.
CollapsedURL is created by replacing dynamic components in the URL, if any, with the keyword DYN.
These dynamic components are automatically identified.
Additionally, any API endpoint that has a collapsedURL with automatically identified DYN components,
will also have DYN-Examples which show a few examples of the original values of the components that were determined to be DYN.
app_typeAPIEPInfo.title: Identified API

access_discovery_time.description:
access_discovery_time is the time when the API endpoint
 was updated from the access logs by the discovery mechanism.
 It is the UTC time and represented in RFC3339 form.
access_discovery_time.title: access_discovery_time

api_groups.description:
List of API Groups the API Endpoint is a member of.

Example: ` ["sensitive", "read-only"]`
api_groups.title: API Groups membership

attributes.description:
List of api endpoint attributes.

Example: ` [GraphQL, login etc.]`
attributes.title: attributes

authentication_types.description: List of authentication types found in the API endpoint and their locations.
authentication_types.title: authentication_types

avg_latency.description:
Average latency observed for the API Endpoint.

Example: ` 2.34`
avg_latency.title: avg_latency

base_path.description:
The base path for this Endpoint.

Example: ` "/v1"`
base_path.title: base_path

category.description:
The category of the API Endpoint relative to API Inventory.

Example: ` APIEP_CATEGORY_DISCOVERED, APIEP_CATEGORY_INVENTORY`
category.title: Category

collapsed_url.description:
URL for automatically identified API

Example: ` "/api/v1/user_id/DYN/vehicle_id/DYN"`
collapsed_url.title: Identified API

compliances.description:
List of compliance frameworks of the Endpoint.

Example: ` ["GDPR", "HIPAA", "CCPA"]`
compliances.title: compliances

domains.description:
List of Domains of the API endpoint

Example: ` "[www.example1.com", "www.example2.com]"`
domains.title: List of domains

dyn_examples.title: Expanded URL(s)

engines.description:
List of engines that detected the endpoint.

Example: ` ["TRAFFIC_INSPECTION", "CODE_ANALYSIS", "CRAWLER"]`
engines.title: engines

err_rsp_count.description:
Number of request with 4xx or 5xx response for the API Endpoint

Example: ` 1234`
err_rsp_count.title: error status code count

has_learnt_schema.description:
Has Learnt Schema flag for request API endpoint.

Example: ` true`
has_learnt_schema.title: Has Learnt Schema

last_tested.description:
api testing last tested time is the time when the API endpoint
 was last tested
last_tested.title: last api testing

max_latency.description:
Maximum latency observed for the API Endpoint.

Example: ` 9.87`
max_latency.title: max_latency

method.description:
HTTP method for the API.

Example: ` "GET"`
method.title: HTTP method

req_rate.description:
Request rate for the API Endpoint.

Example: ` 10.5`
req_rate.title: req_rate

request_percentage.description:
Percentage of requests that were directed to this API Endpoint

Example: ` "78.5789"`
request_percentage.title: Request percentage

requests_count.description:
Number of requests seen for this API Endpoint for the specified time-range.

Example: ` "1234"`
requests_count.title: requests_count

schema_status.description:
Schema status indicates the API Endpoint's schema origin and if it's outdated.

Example: ` "Discovered Not-Updated"`
schema_status.title: schema_status

sec_events_count.description:
Number of sec_events seen for this API Endpoint for the specified time-range.

Example: ` "1234"`
sec_events_count.title: sec_events_count

sensitive_data.description:
List of Sensitive Data found in the API endpoint

Example: ` "[SENSITIVE_DATA_TYPE_CCN, SENSITIVE_DATA_TYPE_SSN, SENSITIVE_DATA_TYPE_IP]"`
sensitive_data.title: List of Sensitive Data

sensitive_data_location.description:
Sensitive data location for the API Endpoint.

Example: ` Request`
sensitive_data_location.title: sensitive data location

sensitive_data_types.description:
List of Sensitive Data found in the API endpoint

Example: ` "[Social-Security-Number, Credit-Card-Number]"`
sensitive_data_types.title: List of Sensitive Data

app_typeAPIEPPDFInfo.description:
Metrics supported currently are request_size response_size latency_with_data, latency_no_data.
PDF is calculated for each combination of (Tenant, App type, API endpoint).
API endpoint is determined from automatically identified API (collapsed_url) and method.
In the univariate case PDFSpec for each metric is repeated num_pdf_samples times.
num_pdf_samples is a parameter is system wide parameter currently set to 200.
app_typeAPIEPPDFInfo.title: Probability Density Function

creation_timestamp.description:
creation_timestamp represents the time when this PDF was created
 It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

error_rate.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for error rate
error_rate.title: PDF(error rate)

latency_no_data.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for latency of response begin
latency_no_data.title: PDF(response latency to first byte)

latency_with_data.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for latency of response end
latency_with_data.title: PDF(response latency)

request_rate.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for request rate
request_rate.title: PDF(request rate)

request_size.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for request size
request_size.title: PDF(request_size)

response_size.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for response size
response_size.title: PDF(response_size)

response_throughput.description: List of Probability density points for PDF for response throughput
response_throughput.title: PDF(response throughput)

app_typeAPIEPPIILevel.description:
API Endpoint's PII Level.

No PII data detected for the given API Endpoint.
Detected PII data for a given API Endpoint.
app_typeAPIEPPIILevel.title: APIEP PII Level

app_typeAPIEPSecurityRisk.description:
Signifies API Endpoint Security Risk Level

Security risk is not detected (for example, when no traffic).
API Endpoint has low security risk.
API Endpoint has medium security risk.
API Endpoint has high security risk.
API Endpoint has critical security risk.
app_typeAPIEPSecurityRisk.title: APIEP Security Risk

api_specs.description: Discovered API Specifications based on API type for eg, OpenAPI or GraphQL schema for API endpoint.

inventory_openapi_spec.description:
Inventory OpenAPI spec for request API endpoint.

Example: ` "{\"info\":{\"description\":\"\",\"title\":\"\",\"version\":\"\"},\"paths\":{\"\/api\/Addresss\":{\"get\":{\"consumes\":[\"application\/json\"],\"description\":\"Swagger auto-generated from learnt schema\",\"parameters\":[{\"description\":\"\",\"in\":\"query\",\"name\":\"test\",\"type\":\"string\"},{\"description\":\"\",\"in\":\"query\",\"name\":\"test1\",\"type\":\"string\"}],\"responses\":{\"200\":{\"description\":\"\"}}}}},\"schemes\":[\"https\",\"http\"],\"swagger\":\"2.0\"}"`
inventory_openapi_spec.title: Inventory OpenAPI Spec

app_typeAPIEndpointPDFRsp.title: API endpoint PDF response

app_typeAPIEndpointsRsp.description: Response shape for GET API endpoints API. It is list of API endpoints discovered
app_typeAPIEndpointsRsp.title: API endpoints GET response

app_typeAPIType.description:
List of possible types of api that can be discovered for an APIEP.

The API Type detected as unknown.
The API Type detected as GraphQL.
The API Type detected as REST.
The API Type detected as gRPC.

app_typeApiEndpointInfoRequest.description:
This is the various forms that can be requested to be sent in the ApiEndpointInfoRequest

API ENDPOINT INFO NONE option is used to disable any additional info request per api endpoint response
API ENDPOINT INFO PDF SPARKLINES option is used to enable pdf sparkline info along with the api endpoint response
app_typeApiEndpointInfoRequest.title: ApiEndpointInfoRequest

app_typeAuthenticationLocation.description:
API Endpoint's Authentication Location.

The API Endpoint authentication location is header.
The API Endpoint authentication location is query parameter.
The API Endpoint authentication location is request body.
The API Endpoint authentication location is cookie.
app_typeAuthenticationLocation.title: APIEP Authentication Location

app_typeAuthenticationState.description:
API Endpoint's Authentication State.

The API Endpoint authentication state is unknown.
The API Endpoint is authenticated
The API Endpoint is unauthenticated
app_typeAuthenticationState.title: APIEP Authentication State

app_typeAuthenticationType.description:
API Endpoint's Authentication Type.

The API Endpoint authentication type is Basic.
The API Endpoint authentication type is Bearer.
The API Endpoint authentication type is JWT.
The API Endpoint authentication type is API Key.
The API Endpoint authentication type is OAuth 2.0.
The API Endpoint authentication type is OpenID Connect Discovery.
The API Endpoint authentication type is HTTP.
The API Endpoint authentication type is OAuth 1.0.
The API Endpoint authentication type is Digest.
The API Endpoint authentication type is Negotiate.
app_typeAuthenticationType.title: APIEP Authentication Type

x-displayName: "Custom Data Detection Config"
The custom data detection config specifies targets, scopes & the pattern to be detected.
app_typeCustomDataDetectionConfig.title: CustomDataDetectionConfig

api_group.description:
x-displayName: "API Group"
x-example: "oas-all-operations"
The rule is applied on the APIs that belong to specified api_group.
API groups derived from API Definition swaggers.
For example oas-all-operations including all paths and methods from the swaggers, oas-base-urls covering all requests under base-paths from the swaggers.
Custom groups can be created if user tags paths or operations with "x-volterra-api-group" extensions inside swaggers.
api_group.title: api_group

base_path.description:
x-example: "/v1"
x-displayName: "Base Path"
The rule is applied only for the requests matching the specified base path.
base_path.title: base path

specific_domain.description:
x-displayName: "Specific Domain"
x-example: "api.example.com"
The rule will apply for a specific domain.
For example: api.example.com
specific_domain.title: domain

custom_sections.description:
x-displayName: "Custom Sections"
x-required
Request & Response Sections.
custom_sections.title: custom_sections

x-displayName: "Custom Sensitive Data Detection Rule"
Custom Sensitive Data Rule Definition.
app_typeCustomSensitiveDataDetectionRule.title: CustomSensitiveDataRule

app_typeCustomSensitiveDataType.description:

app_typeFeatureType.description:
Enumeration for AI/ML features supported

API Discovery enables generation of model for various API interactions between services of App type.
Enable analysis of timeseries for various metric collected like requests, errors, latency etc.
Enable anomaly detection per API request, i.e. the probability density function (PDF) charts generation for API endpoints
Enable user behavior analysis

app_typeGetResponseFormatCode.description:
x-displayName: "Get Response Format"
This is the various forms that can be requested to be sent in the GetResponse

 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_DEFAULT: x-displayName: "Default Format"
Default format of returned resource
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_CREATE: x-displayName: "Create request Format"
Response should be in CreateRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_FOR_REPLACE: x-displayName: "Replace request format"
Response should be in ReplaceRequest format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_STATUS: x-displayName: "Status format"
Response should be in StatusObject(s) format
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_READ: x-displayName: "GetSpecType format"
Response should be in format of GetSpecType
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_REFERRING_OBJECTS: x-displayName: "Referring Objects"
Response should have other objects referring to this object
 - GET_RSP_FORMAT_BROKEN_REFERENCES: x-displayName: "Broken Referred Objects"
Response should have deleted and disabled objects referrred by this object
app_typeGetResponseFormatCode.title: GetResponseFormatCode

app_typePDFSpec.description:
Probability Density point in (PDF(x)) of the metric.
x is the value of the metric, probability is the corresponding PDF(x).
In the univariate case (current configuration), the value x of the metrics is a scaler.
As PDFSpec is repeated (see below), the x values are linearly spaced monotonically from minimum to maximum.
app_typePDFSpec.title: Probability Density Point(x,y)

probability.description:
Probability of given Value of the metric that can be plotted on y-axis

Example: ` "0.078"`
probability.title: Probability

x.description:
Value of the metric that can be plotted on x-axis

Example: ` "121.316"`
x.title: Metric Value

app_typePDFStat.description:
Probability Density Function statistics of the metric.
pdf_mean is the mean PDF of the metric, pdf_95 is the 95th percentile PDF of the metric.
In the univariate case PDFStat for each metric consists of pdf_mean and pdf_95.
app_typePDFStat.title: Probability Density Function Statistics

pdf_95.description:
pdf_95 represents the 95th percentile of PDF

Example: ` "0.078"`
pdf_95.title: PDF 95th Percentile

pdf_mean.description: pdf_mean represents the mean of PDF
pdf_mean.title: PDF Mean

The sensitive data detected as IP address.

The sensitive data detected as phone number.
The sensitive data detected as credentials info(e.g password, username etc).

The sensitive data detected as Location.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

schemaConditionType.description:
Conditions are used in the object status to describe the current state of the
object, e.g. Ready, Succeeded, etc.
schemaConditionType.title: ConditionType

hostname.description: Hostname of the instance of the site that sent the status
hostname.title: hostname

last_update_time.description: Last time the condition was updated
last_update_time.title: last_update_time

reason.description:
x-reason: "Insufficient memory in data plane"
 A human readable string explaining the reason for reaching this condition

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

service_name.description: Name of the service that sent the status
service_name.title: service name

status.description:
Status of the condition
 "Success" Validtion has succeded. Requested operation was successful.
 "Failed"  Validation has failed.
 "Incomplete" Validation of configuration has failed due to missing configuration.
 "Installed" Validation has passed and configuration has been installed in data path or K8s
 "Down" Configuration is operationally down. e.g. down interface
 "Disabled" Configuration is administratively disabled i.e. ObjectMetaType.Disable = true.
 "NotApplicable" Configuration is not applicable e.g. tenant service_policy_set(s) in system namespace are not applicable on REs

Example: ` "Failed"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Success\",\"Failed\",\"Incomplete\",\"Installed\",\"Down\",\"Disabled\",\"NotApplicable\"]
status.title: status

type.description:
Type of the condition
 "Validation" represents validation user given configuration object
 "Operational" represents operational status of a given configuration object

Example: ` "Operational"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.in: [\"Validation\",\"Operational\"]
type.title: type

schemaErrorCode.description:
Union of all possible error-codes from system

 - EOK: No error
 - EPERMS: Permissions error
 - EBADINPUT: Input is not correct
 - ENOTFOUND: Not found
 - EEXISTS: Already exists
 - EUNKNOWN: Unknown/catchall error
 - ESERIALIZE: Error in serializing/de-serializing
 - EINTERNAL: Server error
 - EPARTIAL: Partial error
schemaErrorCode.title: ErrorCode

schemaErrorType.description: Information about a error in API operation
schemaErrorType.title: ErrorType

message.description:
A human readable string of the error

Example: ` "value"`
message.title: message

schemaHttpMethod.description:
x-displayName: "HTTP Method"
Specifies the HTTP method used to access a resource.

 - ANY: x-displayName: "ANY"
Any HTTP Method
 - GET: x-displayName: "GET"
 - HEAD: x-displayName: "HEAD"
 - POST: x-displayName: "POST"
 - PUT: x-displayName: "PUT"
 - DELETE: x-displayName: "DELETE"
 - CONNECT: x-displayName: "CONNECT"
 - OPTIONS: x-displayName: "OPTIONS"
 - TRACE: x-displayName: "TRACE"
 - PATCH: x-displayName: "PATCH"
 - COPY: x-displayName: "COPY"
schemaHttpMethod.title: HttpMethod

 - HTTP_SECTION_NONE: None

ALL_SECTIONS
x-displayName: "None"
 - HTTP_SECTION_QUERY_PARAMS: QUERY_PARAMS

pending.description:
Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is initialized.
 When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers
 struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all
 clients.

schemaMessageMetaType.description:
x-displayName: "Message Metadata"
MessageMetaType is metadata (common attributes) of a message that only certain messages
have. This information is propagated to the metadata of a child object that gets created
from the containing message during view processing.
The information in this type can be specified by user during create and replace APIs.
schemaMessageMetaType.title: MessageMetaType

schemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
schemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then kind will hold the referred object's kind (e.g. "route")

Example: ` "virtual_site"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`

name.description:
This is the name of configuration object. It has to be unique within the namespace.
 It can only be specified during create API and cannot be changed during replace API.
 The value of name has to follow DNS-1035 format.

Example: ` "acmecorp-web"`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
name.title: name

namespace.description:
This defines the workspace within which each the configuration object is to be created.
 Must be a DNS_LABEL format. For a namespace object itself, namespace value will be ""

Example: ` "staging"`
namespace.title: namespace

schemaStatusMetaType.description: StatusMetaType is metadata that all status must have.
schemaStatusMetaType.title: StatusMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
creation_timestamp is when the status object was created. It is used to find/tie-break
 for latest status object from same origin
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
Class of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be service's DNS FQDN.
 This will be set by the system based on client certificate information.

Example: ` "ver.re1.int.ves.io"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
ID of creator which created this StatusObject. This will be a concrete identifier for service (e.g.
 identifying the environment also). This will be set by the system based on client certificate
 information

Example: ` "ver-instance-1"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

status_id.description:
status_id is a field used by the generator to distinguish (if necessary) between two status
 objects for the same config object from the same site and same service and potentially same
 daemon(creator-id)
status_id.title: status_id

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for a StatusObject.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

vtrp_id.description: Origin of this status exchanged by VTRP.
vtrp_id.title: vtrp_id

vtrp_stale.description: Indicate whether mars deems this object to be stale via graceful restart timer information
vtrp_stale.title: vtrp_stale

schemaStatusPublishType.description:
StatusPublishType is all possible publish operations on a StatusObject

 - STATUS_DO_NOT_PUBLISH: Do Not Publish

Do not propagate this status to user. This could be because status is only informational
 - STATUS_PUBLISH: Publish

Propagate this status up to user as it might be actionable
schemaStatusPublishType.title: StatusPublishType

schemaStatusType.description: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.
schemaStatusType.title: StatusType

code.description:
Suggested HTTP return code for this status, 0 if not set.

Example: ` "0"`
code.title: code

reason.description:
A human-readable description of why this operation is in the
 "Failure" status. If this value is empty there
 is no information available.

Example: ` "value"`
reason.title: reason

status.description:
Status of the operation.
 One of: "Success" or "Failure".

Example: ` "value"`
status.title: status

schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.description:
SystemObjectGetMetaType is metadata generated or populated by the system for all persisted objects and
cannot be updated directly by users.
schemaSystemObjectGetMetaType.title: SystemObjectGetMetaType

creation_timestamp.description:
CreationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 created. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations.
 Clients may not set this value. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.
creation_timestamp.title: creation_timestamp

creator_class.description:
A value identifying the class of the user or service which created this configuration object.

Example: ` "value"`
creator_class.title: creator_class

creator_id.description:
A value identifying the exact user or service that created this configuration object

Example: ` "value"`
creator_id.title: creator_id

deletion_timestamp.description:
DeletionTimestamp is RFC 3339 date and time at which this resource will be deleted. This
 field is set by the server when a graceful deletion is requested by the user, and is not
 directly settable by a client. The resource is expected to be deleted (no longer visible
 from resource lists, and not reachable by name) after the time in this field, once the
 finalizers list is empty. As long as the finalizers list contains items, deletion is blocked.
 Once the deletionTimestamp is set, this value may not be unset or be set further into the
 future, although it may be shortened or the resource may be deleted prior to this time.
 For example, a user may request that a pod is deleted in 30 seconds. The Kubelet will react
 by sending a graceful termination signal to the containers in the pod. After that 30 seconds,
 the Kubelet will send a hard termination signal (SIGKILL) to the container and after cleanup,
 remove the pod from the API. In the presence of network partitions, this object may still
 exist after this timestamp, until an administrator or automated process can determine the
 resource is fully terminated.
 If not set, graceful deletion of the object has not been requested.

 Populated by the system when a graceful deletion is requested.
 Read-only.
deletion_timestamp.title: deletion_timestamp

finalizers.description:
Must be empty before the object is deleted from the registry. Each entry
 is an identifier for the responsible component that will remove the entry
 from the list. If the deletionTimestamp of the object is non-nil, entries
 in this list can only be removed.

Example: ` "value"`
finalizers.title: finalizers

labels.description:
Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize
 (scope and select) objects as chosen by the operator or software. Values here can be interpreted
 by software(backend or frontend) to enable certain behavior e.g. things marked as soft-deleted(restorable).

Example: ` "'ves.io/soft-deleted''true'"`
labels.title: labels

modification_timestamp.description:
ModificationTimestamp is a timestamp representing the server time when this object was
 last modified.
modification_timestamp.title: modification_timestamp

object_index.description:
Unique index for the object. Some objects need a unique integer index to be allocated
 for each object type. This field will be populated for all objects that need it and will
 be zero otherwise.

Example: ` "0"`
object_index.title: object_index

tenant.description:
Tenant to which this configuration object belongs to. The value for this is found from
 presented credentials.

Example: ` "acmecorp"`
tenant.title: tenant

uid.description:
uid is the unique in time and space value for this object. It is generated by
 the server on successful creation of an object and is not allowed to change on Replace
 API. The value of is taken from uid field of ObjectMetaType, if provided.

Example: ` "d15f1fad-4d37-48c0-8706-df1824d76d31"`
uid.title: uid

schemaViewRefType.description: ViewRefType represents a reference to a view
schemaViewRefType.title: ViewRefType

kind.description:
Kind of the view object

Example: ` "http_proxy"`
kind.title: kind

name.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then name will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) name.

Example: ` "contactus-route"`
name.title: name

namespace.description:
When a configuration object(e.g. virtual_host) refers to another(e.g route)
 then namespace will hold the referred object's(e.g. route's) namespace.

Example: ` "ns1"`
namespace.title: namespace

uid.description:
UID of the view object

Example: ` "f3744323-1adf-4aaa-a5dc-0707c1d1bd82"`
uid.title: uid
